content:
• Friday, January 6, 2012
  • TXCCQ

    TranSwitch (TXCC) cuts Q4 guidance due to a contractual dispute on a service agreement with one...

    TranSwitch (TXCC) cuts Q4 guidance due to a contractual dispute on a service agreement with one of its North American customers. It now says revenue will come in roughly around $6.3M, below prior guidance and Street estimates of $7M. Shares -8.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • IPCM

    IPC (NASDAQ:IPCM), a provider of inpatient care services for hospitals, drops 12.3% AH after...

    IPC (NASDAQ:IPCM), a provider of inpatient care services for hospitals, drops 12.3% AH after warning it expects Q4 revenue of $115M-$118M and EPS of $0.47-$0.51, below a consensus of $124.4M and $0.54. The company primarily blames the shortfall on "unexpected softness in patient volumes in certain practices," while adding that temporary staffing and practice start-up costs also hurt profitability.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • LULU

    Lululemon (LULU) says its founder and Chief Innovation and Branding Officer Chip Wilson is...

    Lululemon (LULU) says its founder and Chief Innovation and Branding Officer Chip Wilson is stepping down from the post at the end of January, but will continue to serve as chairman of the board. Shares -2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • GS

    Goldman Sachs (GS -1.2%) and Morgan Stanley's (MS -2.3%) Q4 estimates were lowered again today...

    Goldman Sachs (GS -1.2%) and Morgan Stanley's (MS -2.3%) Q4 estimates were lowered again today by Meredith Whitney, cutting Goldman from $2.61 to $1.83, and Morgan Stanley to $0.09 after excluding MBIA charge.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 2 Comments
  • HVT

    Raymond James raises its rating on Haverty Furniture (HVT +4.8%) to Outperform following the...

    Raymond James raises its rating on Haverty Furniture (HVT +4.8%) to Outperform following the company's better-than-expected Q4 sales report. HVT's "better merchandising, best-in-class supply chain, and conservatively managed balance sheet" should allow it to capitalize on improved demand for residential furniture, the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • GLW

    Corning (GLW +2.2%) gets a lift on positive comments out of KeyBanc today. The firm initiates...

    Corning (GLW +2.2%) gets a lift on positive comments out of KeyBanc today. The firm initiates coverage with a Hold on short-term concerns over valuation, but note the company's attractive long-term potential.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • CERN

    Cerner (CERN +1.9%) gets a bump higher after Deutsche raises its rating to Buy on valuation,...

    Cerner (CERN +1.9%) gets a bump higher after Deutsche raises its rating to Buy on valuation, citing expectations for strong bookings growth

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • INHX

    Shares of Inhibitex (INHX +2.3%) tack on a gain, helped along with a note from Noble Financial's...

    Shares of Inhibitex (INHX +2.3%) tack on a gain, helped along with a note from Noble Financial's Nathan Cali to clients saying he believes the firm's INX-189 drug increases the chances of a "lucrative" partnership deal or merger in the future.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • FDO

    Some analysts defend Family Dollar (FDO -7.5%) after the discount retailer's FQ1 gross margins...

    Some analysts defend Family Dollar (FDO -7.5%) after the discount retailer's FQ1 gross margins dwindled. Citi says FDO can "more than offset the deterioration through better SG&A leverage," and points to "the closing of its performance gap vs. Dollar General (NYSE:DG) in both sales per square foot and EBIT margin."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • AGCO

    Agco (AGCO +2.2%) pays $31M for a 60% stake in Santal Equipamentos, a Brazilian company that...

    Agco (AGCO +2.2%) pays $31M for a 60% stake in Santal Equipamentos, a Brazilian company that makes mechanized sugar-cane harvesters. Sugar-cane harvesters are expected to be hot sellers in Brazil over the coming years, as the government tries to eliminate the practice of burning fields to make the cane easier to cut by hand.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • PES

    Pioneer Drilling (PDC +2.9%) gains after Morgan Keegan upgrades the stock to Outperform on...

    Pioneer Drilling (PDC +2.9%) gains after Morgan Keegan upgrades the stock to Outperform on valuation, saying the shares are poised for a breakout on the back of solid growth in production and drilling services.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • CECO

    Career Education (CECO -0.5%) trades in the red today after Argus cut the shares to Hold, citing...

    Career Education (CECO -0.5%) trades in the red today after Argus cut the shares to Hold, citing the school's ongoing job placement scandal.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • CMC

    Analysts weigh in on Commercial Metals' (CMC +6.1%) FQ1 report, with D.A. Davidson's Taryn Kuida...

    Analysts weigh in on Commercial Metals' (CMC +6.1%) FQ1 report, with D.A. Davidson's Taryn Kuida calling out the significant profit improvement across segments and CRT Capital's Kuni Chen seeing the "good" report and Carl Icahn drama leading to higher bids in the weeks ahead.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • RBN

    Robbins & Myers (RBN -1.7%) reverses its opening pop and trades lower after reporting a...

    Robbins & Myers (RBN -1.7%) reverses its opening pop and trades lower after reporting a mixed FQ1, beating a per share basis but missing the mark on revenue due to temporary plant shutdowns. Profit soared as the company continues to benefit from its acquisition of T-3 Energy Services Inc. The company also raised its full-year guidance, now expecting to earn $3.00 - $ 3.20 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • ZNGA

    Not helping slumping Zynga (ZNGA -4%) shares is Macquarie analyst Ben Schachter launching...

    Not helping slumping Zynga (ZNGA -4%) shares is Macquarie analyst Ben Schachter launching coverage at Neutral despite his bullish take on video games moving online. Especially troubling, he says, is that only a relatively small fraction of ZNGA's 150M monthly users actually pay for anything, making it dependent upon a limited group of high-spending “whales.”
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM | 5 Comments
  • ICE

    IntercontinentalExchange (ICE -1.3%) trades down after JP Morgan cut the shares to Neutral on...

    IntercontinentalExchange (ICE -1.3%) trades down after JP Morgan cut the shares to Neutral on valuation earlier today, citing overly aggressive Street estimates.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • INFO

    IHS (IHS +2%) gains after its FQ4 beat estimates on a big jump in revenue, which helped to...

    IHS (IHS +2%) gains after its FQ4 beat estimates on a big jump in revenue, which helped to offset sharply higher pension expenses. Acquisitions added 17% to its bottom line, putting organic revenue growth at 9.4% for the year. Subscription revenue, the largest component of its top line, climbed 21% from a year earlier to $273M.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • XIDEQ

    Shares of Exide Technologies (XIDE +11.1%) shoot higher, emboldened by an upgrade from Wedbush...

    Shares of Exide Technologies (XIDE +11.1%) shoot higher, emboldened by an upgrade from Wedbush to Outperform from Neutral. An analyst with the firm cites a litany of reasons for the ratings boost, highlighted by the belief the market has fully priced in the operating challenges of the electric battery maker.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM | 2 Comments
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA -2.2%) has had a rough week, and is making fresh post-IPO lows today. A possible...

    Zynga (ZNGA -2.2%) has had a rough week, and is making fresh post-IPO lows today. A possible culprit is a lack of enthusiasm for Zynga's BKS <font color="green">+1.2%</font>) pares its gains after CEO William Lynch makes an anticipated <a href="http://paidcontent.org/article/419-bn-ceo-the-nook-will-continue-to-be-barnes-nobles-e-reader/">CNBC appearance</a>. During the talk, Lynch tried to assuage fears the planned <a href="https://seekingalpha.com/currents/post/108514">Nook spinoff</a> will impact the use of B&N stores to promote Nook devices, and attempts to explain the weaker-than-expected performance of the <a href="https://seekingalpha.com/currents/post/77313">Nook Simple Touch</a>, which faces tough competition from the <a href="https://seekingalpha.com/currents/post/93504">Kindle Touch</a>. (<a href="https://seekingalpha.com/currents/search?query=nook">more</a>)</p>">just-launched Hidden Chronicles game. Paul Tassi notes the game bears a strong resemblance to Playdom's (NYSE:DIS) wildly popular Gardens of Time, and sees it as evidence that Zynga "refuses to innovate in any way."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • IPSU

    Imperial Sugar (IPSU -5.4%) gets hit after its Q4 beats on revenue but misses on a per share...

    Imperial Sugar (IPSU -5.4%) gets hit after its Q4 beats on revenue but misses on a per share basis. Losses widened due to impairment charges, continuing high costs for raw and refined sugar and a 27% drop in the refined-sugar processor's sales volume.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • AZZ

    Electrical and industrial products manufacturer AZZ (AZZ +1%) trades higher despite missing on...

    Electrical and industrial products manufacturer AZZ (AZZ +1%) trades higher despite missing on its FQ3 revenue, as investors look past the current quarter and focus on raised FY guidance. It now anticipates 2012 earnings to be $3.00 - $3.15 per share on revenues of $465M - $475M. Prior guidance was for an EPS of $2.90 - $3.10 on revenues of $450M - $475M. Analysts are looking for an EPS of $3.08 on revenues of $460M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +0.1%) gives back today's gains after CEO William Lynch makes an...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +0.1%) gives back today's gains after CEO William Lynch makes an anticipated CNBC appearance. During the talk, Lynch tried to assuage fears the planned Nook spinoff will impact the use of B&N stores to promote Nook devices, and attempts to explain the weaker-than-expected performance of the Nook Simple Touch, which faces tough competition from the Kindle Touch. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • FMCN

    Shares of Focus Media (FMCN -6.7%) take on another assault from Muddy Waters (report), this time...

    Shares of Focus Media (FMCN -6.7%) take on another assault from Muddy Waters (report), this time questioning the "bizarre" acquisition of a ginseng plantation on the Russian and North Korea border from one its employees.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • ITMN

    InterMune (ITMN +5%) rallies after Brean Murray calls it a top 2012 pick, citing a low valuation...

    InterMune (ITMN +5%) rallies after Brean Murray calls it a top 2012 pick, citing a low valuation and strong German demand for InterMune's Esbriet lung disease drug. Brean's call is more than offsetting a PT cut from Goldman (Neutral), which thinks uncertainty over future Esbriet pricing "creates an overhang that is likely to persist through the middle of 2012."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • REGN

    Regeneron (REGN +7.1%) kicks up a healthy gain after Jefferies tags the firm with an upgrade to...

    Regeneron (REGN +7.1%) kicks up a healthy gain after Jefferies tags the firm with an upgrade to Buy from Hold. Analysts cite heightened demand for Regeneron's Eylea drug including its distribution by Express Scripts via a subsidiary.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • SABA

    Though it sold off yesterday after delivering its FQ2 report, HR software firm Saba Software...

    Though it sold off yesterday after delivering its FQ2 report, HR software firm Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA +14.6%) is now up sharply. Investors might be pleased with the strong performance of Saba's burgeoning cloud software business: cloud revenue rose 64% Y/Y, while cloud deferred revenue rose 113%. In addition, Saba predicts its total cloud billings will grow over 60% in FY12. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • QRVO

    RF Micro Devices (RFMD -18.6%) is making new 52-week lows following yesterday's FQ3 warning (I,...

    RF Micro Devices (RFMD -18.6%) is making new 52-week lows following yesterday's FQ3 warning (I, II), and (owing to RF Micro blaming the shortfall on 2G Chinese orders) has triggered a crash in Spreadtrum (SPRD -15.9%) along the way. Oppenheimer and D.A. Davidson are downgrading RF Micro in response, with the latter arguing the company's weak margin guidance indicates growing 2G competition and price pressure.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • ANGO

    AngioDynamics (ANGO -5.8%) takes a hit after its FQ2 earnings missed the mark across the board....

    AngioDynamics (ANGO -5.8%) takes a hit after its FQ2 earnings missed the mark across the board. Profit fell 29% Y/Y, primarily due to costs related to a recall of some its NeverTouch procedure kits. Gross margin was also down, reflecting the impact of ongoing programs to reduce material costs and increase its manufacturing efficiency.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • BYD

    Boyd Gaming (BYD -4%) trades down after JP Morgan cut the shares to Underweight on valuation,...

    Boyd Gaming (BYD -4%) trades down after JP Morgan cut the shares to Underweight on valuation, noting increased competition in its Atlantic City market.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • APOL

    Apollo Group's (APOL +5.9%) first growth in new enrollments in at least a year shoots shares...

    Apollo Group's (APOL +5.9%) first growth in new enrollments in at least a year shoots shares higher and propels other major for-profit education companies: EDMC +2.7%, DV +6.1%, WPO +1.2%, STRA +1.4%, BPI +2.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • SCHW

    Deutsche says the environment is getting more and more challenging for online brokers, and the...

    Deutsche says the environment is getting more and more challenging for online brokers, and the sector is likely to face continued headwinds going into 2012. Given current valuations, the firm cuts Charles Schwab (SCHW +0.7%) to Hold and recommends swapping out of it and into TD Ameritrade (AMTD +1.4%), upping it from Hold to Buy. The firm calls AMTD its top pick in the sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +6.9%) shares are soaring, making it not only the best performing stock in the...

    Netflix (NFLX +6.9%) shares are soaring, making it not only the best performing stock in the S&P 500 today but for the year so far, up 22%-plus on no news. The stock that had been "the plaything of momentum traders" last year apparently has resumed its old role, Mark Gongloff cracks.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 6 Comments
  • KODK

    Arriving late to the party once again, both Moody's and S&P (I,II) cut their ratings on...

    Arriving late to the party once again, both Moody's and S&P (I,II) cut their ratings on Eastman Kodak (EK -8.1%) further into junk territory, citing the company's likely bankruptcy filing and deteriorating liquidity.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 4 Comments
  • CMC

    Commercial Metals (CMC +2.6%) CFO Barbara Smith responds to Carl Icahn's overture to...

    Commercial Metals (CMC +2.6%) CFO Barbara Smith responds to Carl Icahn's overture to shareholders on an earnings CC, saying the investor's offer "undervalues" the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK +2.06%) moves higher after Sterne Agee raises it to Buy, saying that most of the...

    SanDisk (SNDK +2.06%) moves higher after Sterne Agee raises it to Buy, saying that most of the negative handset sentiment is now reflected in the stock price, and margins should see improvement from a lower yen.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • HGG

    Shares of hhgregg (HGG +9.3%) go on a tear, easily outdistancing other specialty retailer names...

    Shares of hhgregg (HGG +9.3%) go on a tear, easily outdistancing other specialty retailer names bouncing around in positive territory despite a sluggish tape.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • PSMT

    Shares of PriceSmart (PSMT -17.5%) are getting clobbered this morning after missing FQ1...

    Shares of PriceSmart (PSMT -17.5%) are getting clobbered this morning after missing FQ1 estimates and posting a 5.8% Y/Y decline in net income. Better overall sales were overshadowed by markedly higher operating expenses and the inability to raise prices to offset the increase.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG -2%) dips after Capital One cut the shares to Neutral on valuation...

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG -2%) dips after Capital One cut the shares to Neutral on valuation this morning. Today's weakness is just a drop in the bucket however, when you consider that the stock has already rocketed 180% higher since early October.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 4 Comments
  • CROX

    Shoe Carnival's FQ4 warning spills over to taint shares of Crox (CROX -4.4%) and DSW (DSW -2.9%)...

    Shoe Carnival's FQ4 warning spills over to taint shares of Crox (CROX -4.4%) and DSW (DSW -2.9%) on concerns that a similar weakness in sales could hit the shoe sellers.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • AA

    Alcoa (AA -2.7%) is selling off after announcing a restructuring plan meant to cope with a weak...

    Alcoa (AA -2.7%) is selling off after announcing a restructuring plan meant to cope with a weak demand/pricing environment, and is taking some other aluminum makers down with it. NOR -5.6%. ACH -3%. AWC -2.6%. Dahlman Rose (Buy) thinks Alcoa's move will help stabilize aluminum prices; other aluminum producers have also been cutting output. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • BHC

    Shares of Valeant (VRX -2.3%) hit some volatility this morning after its 2012 guidance...

    Shares of Valeant (VRX -2.3%) hit some volatility this morning after its 2012 guidance presentation. The company sees Q4 earnings in the mid-range of estimates, while it ups 2012 EPS estimates to between $3.95 - $4.20. More importantly, the company says there's still no agreement on the buyout process or price with Ista Pharmaceuticals (ISTA -0.4%), following Ista's rejection of its recent bid in December, and puts a drop dead date of January 31 for negotiations.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • KKD

    Shares of Krispy Kreme (KKD +4.3%) perk up to hit a 3-week high. It's not the extra +200K...

    Shares of Krispy Kreme (KKD +4.3%) perk up to hit a 3-week high. It's not the extra +200K workers in the U.S. eating donuts on their way to work doing the trick - but an upgrade from analysts at Stephens to Overweight from Equal Weight.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 3 Comments
  • JAZZ

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (JAZZ +7.9%) double up on its AH gain yesterday following its upward...

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (JAZZ +7.9%) double up on its AH gain yesterday following its upward revision for 2012 revenue. Adding to the momentum, analysts at Muzho upped their price target on shares to $62 from $52 based on the firm's rosy outlook.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • UCBI

    United Community Bank (UCBI -9.1%) falls on word that the bank holding company will restate...

    United Community Bank (UCBI -9.1%) falls on word that the bank holding company will restate results for Q1-Q3 of 2011 and all of 2010. The accounting do-over stems from concerns expressed by the SEC on the treatment of deferred tax assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • ENOC

    Shares of EnerNOC (ENOC -17.4%) implode after power wholesaler PJM files a request with the...

    Shares of EnerNOC (ENOC -17.4%) implode after power wholesaler PJM files a request with the Federal Energy Regulator Commission that could adversely effect the firm's margins and sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • OUTR

    Coinstar (CSTR -4.2%) slides after Morgan Keegan cuts its rating to Market Perform and its...

    Coinstar (CSTR -4.2%) slides after Morgan Keegan cuts its rating to Market Perform and its price target to $42 from $60, noting uncertainty in the DVD industry after Time Warner doubles the period in which it will bar Redbox, Netflix and Blockbuster from renting new releases. Shares will "remain pressured until the company provides further evidence of a life beyond DVD."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM | 2 Comments
  • ADRNY

    Shares of Delhaize (DEG) push 4.2% higher premarket, as analysts see the Belgiim-based...

    Shares of Delhaize (DEG) push 4.2% higher premarket, as analysts see the Belgiim-based supermarket operator as a possible beneficiary of an increase in employment in the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM
  • GPN

    Global Payments (NYSE:GPN) -4.7% premarket after reporting FQ2 EPS of $0.78, missing consensus...

    Global Payments (NYSE:GPN) -4.7% premarket after reporting FQ2 EPS of $0.78, missing consensus by $0.03, and revenues of $530.5M, $5.9M above consensus. The company raises FY2012 guidance: EPS to $3.14-$3.22 from $3.13-$3.20, revenues to $2.15B-$2.2B from $2.1B-$2.15B.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM
  • KITD

    KIT digital (OTC:KITD) +9.3% premarket after reaffirming Q4 guidance and raising its 2012...

    KIT digital (OTC:KITD) +9.3% premarket after reaffirming Q4 guidance and raising its 2012 outlook to reflect its accretive recent acquisition of Sezmi Corp. The provider of video management software says it has not experienced a slowdown related to eurozone turbulence and reiterates a "positive bias" towards current and revised 2012 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM

  • Already higher before the number, European shares gain a bit more on following the NFP print....

    Already higher before the number, European shares gain a bit more on following the NFP print. Stoxx 50 +1.1%. Italy leading the way, +1.5%. The euro looks officially disconnected from "risk" moves, moving to its low of the day and lowest in 16 months at $1.2756.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM

  • Italian, Spanish and Austrian government bond yields are higher ahead of auctions next week due...

    Italian, Spanish and Austrian government bond yields are higher ahead of auctions next week due to the usual worries over Greece, Spain and Hungary, although  sentiment on the latter is improving. Despite ECB intervention, Italian 10-year yields +3 bps at 7.12%, Spain +5 bps at 5.68%, and Austria +12 bps at 3.49%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM
  • BSX

    Boston Scientific (NYSE:BSX) moves up 5.8% in premarket trading after a SEC filing showing...

    Boston Scientific (NYSE:BSX) moves up 5.8% in premarket trading after a SEC filing showing insider buying adds to positive sentiment.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM
  • PSMT

    PriceSmart (NASDAQ:PSMT): FQ1 EPS of $0.51 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $468.3M (+24.1% Y/Y)...

    PriceSmart (NASDAQ:PSMT): FQ1 EPS of $0.51 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $468.3M (+24.1% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Shares -5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM
  • BDSI

    Shares of BioDelivery Sciences (NASDAQ:BDSI) shoot up 33% premarket after the firm announces a...

    Shares of BioDelivery Sciences (NASDAQ:BDSI) shoot up 33% premarket after the firm announces a worldwide license and development agreement with Endo Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ENDP) for the rights to commercialize chronic pain treatment BEMA Buprenorphine.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:24 AM

  • German new industrial orders -4.8% M/M in November vs. +5% in October and -1.7% forecast....

    German new industrial orders -4.8% M/M in November vs. +5% in October and -1.7% forecast. Foreign orders -7.8%, domestic orders -1.1%. The euro takes a dive from earlier highs and is now -0.1% vs. the dollar.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:29 AM | 9 Comments
  • VOD

    Vodafone (NASDAQ:VOD) +0.8% premarket in thin trading, and +1.85% in London, after Goldman Sachs...

    Vodafone (NASDAQ:VOD) +0.8% premarket in thin trading, and +1.85% in London, after Goldman Sachs raises the stock to Buy from Neutral. Goldman sees "a potential total return of 55% over the next two years" as free cash flow is lifted by earnings and dividend growth at Verizon Wireless and regulatory pressure fades.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 AM
